c74object.name: j.out
c74object.description: j.out is an output conduit for control signals in a Jamoma model (most often these are Jitter matrices), much like j.out~ is for audio signals. It allows to turn on or off messages output from the model or bypass the value processing in the model when used in combination with j.in
c74object.discussion:
When the model's 'amenities attribute is set to all or data, j.out automatically creates a few nodes under the containing model namespace so its features can be remotely addressed. Hence it creates a data/active node under the Jamoma model it is created in so that messages sent from the model can be muted. When used in combination with j.in, it also creates a data/bypass node so that messages sent to the model can be muted from j.in outlet and directly sent to paired j.out. It also creates a data/out.<argument> so that values sent from the model can be listened remotely.
When j.in/out features are excluded from amenities (ie. @amenities none), these nodes are removed from the namespace and the services are disabled

inlet.digest: Values to output from the model
inlet.description: Values to output from the model

objarg.name: instance name
objarg.digest: Instance name to subscribe output in Jamoma namespace
objarg.description: An argument set to j.out sets a instance name to subscribe output in Jamoma namespace. The full address of this node will be <model name>/data/out.<argument>

method.name: anything
method.digest: Value to output from the model
method.description: When the data/active parameter is set to 1 (default), any message sent to j.out inlet gets output from your model. When a j.in object sharing the same instance name defined as argument is placed within the model and the internal parameter data/bypass is set to 1 (default = 0), values sent at j.in inlet will be received directly by the paired j.out object.

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message outputs all attributes value out of j.out rightmost outlet

attribute.name: mute
attribute.description: The mute attribute turns on or off value output. This attribute is internally linked to the model's parameter data/active

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Set the type of the outcoming value
attribute.description: The type attribute sets the type of the outcoming values (default = control)
